message.content:
{
  "id": "45145",
  "title": "Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using first",
  "description": "When using two Eclipse windows, whenever I switch from another application to one Eclipse window, and then click on a docked view or perspective, the other window comes to the front, obscuring my other application's windows.",
  "OB": "The expected behavior is that when clicking on a docked view or perspective in one Eclipse window, only that window should come to the front, without affecting the positioning of other application windows.",
  "EB": "Instead, when clicking on a docked view or perspective in one Eclipse window, the second window is brought to the front, overlapping my other application windows.",
  "SR": "To fix this bug, the Eclipse application should ensure that clicking on a docked view or perspective in one window does not bring the second window to the front, and instead only brings that window to the front."
}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '45145', 'title': 'Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and thenclick on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my otherapplications' windows. "}
